author: @nzherald
title: Huntly water meters ripped out, police investigating vandalism
text:
Police are investigating a string of vandalised water meters in Huntly that almost left the Waikato town without water.
According to a Waikato District Council press release, vandals used a vehicle and chain to rip about 10 water meters out of place in one night.
“The result of the ripped-out water meters was a large-scale loss of treated drinking water across Huntly.”
Huntly General ward councillor David Whyte told the Waikato Herald the community came “really close” to running out of water.
“[If that happens] schools can’t open. People can’t shower before work. You can’t function.”

author: marisela.valencia
title: Plataformas gratis para mantenerte en forma y comer saludable, ¡cumple tus propósitos!
text:
Al inicio de cada año, la mayoría nos proponemos cambiar nuestros hábitos para estar más saludables. Sin embargo, muchas veces no sabemos por dónde comenzar. Para darte un empujón, conoce estas plataformas para mantenerte en forma y comer saludable, gratis.
El concepto de mantenerse en forma, no solo se refiere a tener el peso “ideal” o una complexión física delgada, sino a llevar hábitos que nos permitan estar saludables. Estos incluyen la alimentación, ejercicio, hábitos de sueño, hidratación y manejo del estrés.
Pero, sin duda, lo que nos cuesta más trabajo, es el tema del ejercicio y la alimentación. Por suerte, actualmente hay plataformas gratuitas que ofrecen entrenamientos, recetas saludables e incluso planes de alimentación para mantenernos en forma y cuidar nuestros hábitos.
Te recomendamos: Conoce las dietas más populares del mundo y en qué consisten
Reto 21
Si buscas una plataforma donde puedas obtener un plan de alimentación según tus necesidades, rutinas de ejercicio y hasta clases de cocina con recetas saludables, Reto 21 de Splenda es para ti.
Por tercer año consecutivo, la marca de endulzantes sin calorías lanzó esta iniciativa para acompañarte en tu objetivo de comenzar el año con un estilo de vida más equilibrado. Se trata de un programa de 21 días con acceso a materiales para potenciar tu bienestar.
La plataforma cuenta con la colaboración de Ale Rubio, Magally Guerra y Javier Vázquez en el lado del ejercicio; Daniel Ferraez en el yoga, y Juliana Cisneros y Luz Colsa en las clases de cocina.
Todo es cien por ciento digital y gratuito, solo necesitas registrarte en la página web para tener acceso al calendario de clases y tu plan de alimentación con recetas incluidas. Apúrate que el reto arranca el 27 de enero.
Nike Traininig Club
Nike Training Club (NTC) es una de las apps que no solo van a ocupar espacio en tu celular, también te van a ayudar a mantenerte en forma, pues es una de las opciones más completas para entrenar sin salir de casa.
Con solo descargarla, puedes acceder a rutinas gratuitas diseñadas por entrenadores profesionales.
Una de sus ventajas, es que ofrece opciones para los diferentes niveles de condición física e incluye entrenamientos para todos los gustos. O sea, que lo mismo encuentras ejercicios de fuerza, que yoga o cardio, además de rutinas cortas y de alta intensidad.
Para mejorar tu condición física, ofrece programas con rutinas progresivas, además de tips de nutrición y salud mental para alcanzar tus objetivos. Y no te preocupes por no saber hacer los ejercicios, cada uno viene con un video explicativo de la técnica, así evitas lesiones.
Si te interesa, está disponible para Android e iOS.
FitOn
Si admiras los cuerpos de las celebridades, FitOn se convertirá en tu plataforma fitness favorita, pues incluye entrenamientos en video dirigidos por los entrenadores de los famosos. Algunos de los implicados son Halle Berry, Gab Union, Kenta Seki y Julianne Hough.
Solo necesitas registrarte para tener acceso gratuito a clases de yoga, pilates, HIIT, kickboxing, estiramientos y muchos más. Un plus es que puedes entrenar solo a tu ritmo o hacerlo en tiempo real con tus amigos.
También cuentan con programas personalizados para alcanzar tus metas y otras herramientas, como planes de alimentación, recetas, ejercicios para meditar y reducir tu estrés, así como algunos cursos relacionados con el bienestar. Eso sí, toma en cuenta que está en inglés.
Yazio
No solo el ejercicio cuenta a la hora de llevar un estilo de vida más saludable, la alimentación es otro pilar muy importante. Yazio es una app disponible para Android e iOS, que te ayudará a planificar tu dieta.
Al descargarla, tienes acceso a un registro de alimentos y calorías, por lo que podrás llevar un control de tu consumo diario si te apegas a un plan basado en ellas.
Además, te dan recomendaciones de menús equilibrados y planes según lo que desees, como perder peso o ganar músculo. Incluso, tienes la opción de planes de ayuno intermitente.
Finalmente, tiene más de dos mil 500 recetas para todos los gustos y necesidades, así que la falta de creatividad no será pretexto para alcanzar tus metas este año.
YouTube
La plataforma de videos gratuita, nunca nos falla. Además de música y entretenimiento, en YouTube encontramos canales enfocados en entrenamientos, así como recetas saludables para mejorar nuestra alimentación.
Si buscas rutinas cortas y sin utilizar equipos, los canales MadFit, de Maddie Lymburner, y Fausto Murillo son una excelente opción. Ambos ofrecen programas para principiantes, además de rutinas de cardio y fuerza. Pero si prefieres alta intensidad, Pamela Reif es para ti.
Otro canal que ha ganado popularidad, es el de Sascha Fitness, donde también puedes encontrar recetas saludables. Para más comida rica y nutritiva, está la Cocina de Addy, el Chef Oropeza, Pizca de Sabor y Cocina Delirante.
¿Cómo empezar a llevar un estilo de vida saludable?
- Comienza con pequeños cambios. Intentar cambiar todos tus hábitos de golpe, puede terminar en frustración. Mejor comienza de a poco, como añadir más verduras a tus comidas o hacer ejercicio tres veces por semana.
- Mantén una alimentación equilibrada. Reduce o evita tu consumo de alimentos ultraprocesados. Mejor, prioriza aquellos naturales y ricos en nutrientes, como frutas y verduras frescas, proteínas magras, legumbres y grasas saludables (aguacate, aceite de oliva, frutos secos).
- Haz ejercicio de forma regular. Para que no te cueste trabajo, elige una actividad que disfrutes. Puede ser desde caminar hasta nadar o levantar pesas, el chiste es moverte al menos 30 minutos al día.
- Descansa. El sueño también tiene un papel clave en la salud. Intenta dormir entre 7 y 9 horas diarias para permitir que tu cuerpo y mente se recuperen.
- Mantente hidratado a lo largo del día. La necesidad de líquidos varía, pero un promedio entre 2 y 3 litros suele ser el adecuado.
- Controla el estrés. El estrés crónico puede afectar tu salud. Busca formas de relajarte, como la meditación, la respiración profunda o actividades recreativas que disfrutes.
- Sé constante, pero flexible. No pasa nada si no sigues tu plan al cien por ciento todos los días, lo importante es mantenerlo a largo plazo.
Este año sí vas a cumplir tu propósito de incorporar hábitos saludables a tu día a día. Únete a estas plataformas para mantenerte en forma y comer saludable, son gratis y serán tus mejores aliadas.
Mantente en forma con este ejercicio de 3 minutos:

author: Gabe Fernandez
title: Warriors are reportedly open to trading another key piece from 2022 title team
text:
The
Golden State Warriors are reportedly leaving the door open to possibly trading another one of the core members of the 2022 championship-winning team.
The Athletic’s
Tim Kawakami published an article Thursday that discussed Andrew Wiggins and his fellow wing Jonathan Kuminga, and what the Dubs could possibly do if they can’t coexist. A potential answer is to find a suitable trade partner — for Wiggins.
In a “side note,” Kawakami reported that Wiggins’ relatively cheap extension “would not be a major barrier for the Warriors to explore Wiggins’ trade market. Especially if he can’t play with Kuminga and the Warriors decide that Kuminga is their full-time small forward.” Kawakami noted that he had previously believed that the extension — a team-friendly
four-year, $109 million deal that was a discount considering the role Wiggins played on a championship team — would stop the Dubs from shopping the 28-year-old forward.
Advertisement
Article continues below this ad
While Wiggins is coming off one of his best games of the season, scoring 22 points on 7-of-11 shooting in a Christmas Day loss to the Nuggets, it’s been a rather rough season for the former No. 1 overall pick. His scoring and offensive production have been down across the board, and ESPN’s Kendra Andrews reported last month that Warriors were
“annoyed” with his poor conditioning heading into this season. Seeing Kuminga come into form this season could very well indicate to the front office that it’s time to accelerate the end of Wiggins’ tenure with the Warriors.
At the same time, it’s difficult to say for sure if the team has to move on from the Canadian wing. As Kawakami noted, whether Wiggins stays or goes depends on how he meshes within different Golden State lineups. That’s a hard thing for the team to get a proper sense of with Draymond Green currently on an
indefinite suspension.
The
Jordan Poole trade this offseason was a sign that being a pivotal member of the Warriors’ last championship team wasn’t enough to prevent a trade. Now it’s time to see whether Wiggins noticed.

author: Édouard le Ricque
title: Les boutons de volume de votre iPhone ne vont plus fonctionner sur Spotify Connect
text:
Les utilisateurs iPhone ou iPad de Spotify devraient bientôt ne plus pouvoir utiliser le bouton volume de leur smartphone pour régler celui-ci lorsqu’ils passent par Spotify Connect. Spotify Connect, c’est la fonction qui permet de diffuser sa musique sans fil (via Wi-Fi) sur des appareils distants comme une enceinte, un PC, un téléviseur connecté ou une console de jeux.
Jusqu’alors, on pouvait régler le volume de ceux-ci en utilisant les boutons correspondants de l’iPhone. Sur sa page de support , Spotify indique que « Apple a mis fin à la technologie qui permet à Spotify de contrôler le volume des appareils connectés. »
Une modification qui, aux yeux du géant suédois du streaming, constituerait une violation de l’article 6, paragraphe 7 du DMA .
De notre côté, nous avons essayé avec un iPhone et une enceinte Bose Portable Home Speaker. Nous n’avons rencontré aucun souci du genre. Logique, puisque le changement ne sera effectif que le 3 septembre, mais il semble que certains utilisateurs l’ont déjà observé.
Spotify
Télécharger gratuitement Comment régler le volume via Spotify Connect Lorsque ce sera le cas pour tous, Spotify indique la marche à suivre pour contourner cette limitation :
Essayez d’appuyer sur le bouton de volume sur le côté de votre appareil. Appuyez sur la notification. Ajustez le volume à l’aide du curseur. Il faudra donc en passer par un contrôle de volume numérique directement dans l’application Spotify et donc pas la voie de l’affichage plutôt que par un simple bouton, plus pratique évitant ainsi d’avoir à déverrouiller l’appareil.
The Verge , qui rapporte l’information, indique que Spotify reproche à Apple de lui refuser l’accès à la même technologie qui permet à Apple Music d’être utilisé sur des appareils tiers.
« Nous avons fait des demandes à Apple pour introduire une solution similaire à ce qu’ils offrent aux utilisateurs sur HomePod et Apple TV pour les développeurs d’applications qui contrôlent des appareils multimédias non-Apple » , explique Spotify.
« Apple nous a dit qu’elle exigeait que les apps s’intègrent aux HomePod afin d’accéder à la technologie qui contrôle le volume sur les iPhone. »
Et Spotify n’aurait pas opté pour les API requises, conclut The Verge.

author: Todd Dykes
title: Hamilton man accused of trying to lure 8-year-old boy from park during softball game
text:
Hamilton man accused of trying to lure 8-year-old boy from park during softball game
Danifer Mark charged with child enticement, aggravated menacing
Danifer Mark charged with child enticement, aggravated menacing
Danifer Mark charged with child enticement, aggravated menacing
Danifer Mark of Hamilton was booked into the Butler County Jail on Tuesday night. Police charged the 42-year-old Mark with child enticement and aggravated menacing, both first-degree misdemeanors.
A police officer made the arrest after parents called to say Mark — who was shooting videos of girls playing softball — tried to keep recording inside one of the team's dugouts.
According to notes from an investigator, Mark also shot video of kids running around and playing near the Badin Rams softball field.
Then, Mark allegedly started talking to an 8-year-old boy, putting his arm around the boy and walking him away from the field.
Mark apparently said to the child, "Come with me."
Parents intervened. The boy's uncle confronted Mark, who was accused of threatening to follow the boy's 41-year-old uncle home and kill him, allegedly telling the uncle he would wait for him to leave Joyce Park and that he knew what car the boy's uncle was driving.
WLWT's Todd Dykes talked to the boy's mother on Wednesday. While she declined to do an interview, the boy's mother was clearly upset with what took place during a family-friendly ballgame on what was supposed to be a quiet Tuesday night.
During his arraignment on Wednesday, a judge set Danifer Mark's bond at just north of $10,000. Mark is due back in court next week.

title: CSS Grid is a powerful tool to create layouts - DEV Community
text: In this post I will show you how you can make entire interfaces with a property of the CSS Grid. [ ](#css-grid-terminology) CSS Grid Terminology First let's take a look quickly about CSS Grid terminology. Grid Container : The element on which grid is applied. The grid container is the parent of grid items. Grid Item : All directly nested elements of a grid container. Grid Cell : Every column in every row is a grid cell.CSS Grid can handle columns and rows, it is a 2-dimensional system. [ ](#the-grid-container-property) The Grid container property grid-template-areas: With this property we define the names of the grid areas and reference them with the grid-area property. [ ](#the-grid-item-property) The Grid item property grid-area: With this property you give a name to an item so that it can be referenced in the grid-template-areas template. [ ](#creating-a-template) Creating a template. In the body of the HTML file, we have a div element with class container. This is the parent element. Inside of the container we created four children elements (header, section, aside and footer) each with class grid-item. With the CSS file we set layout with Grid. First, we define the div with class container as a grid container. After, using the property grid-template-areas we make the grid template by referencing the names of each grid-area property. Repeating the name of a grid-area causes the content to span those cells. A period (.) makes a empty grid cell. And none signifies no grid areas are defined. This is a template with four columns and four rows. The header spans all four columns in the first row. The footer spans all four columns in the last row. The main spans the first three columns in the second and third rows. And the aside spans the last column of lines two and three. We also define a gap: 5px; and the height: 100vh; The result is shown in the figure below: Its possible to change the size of each grid-item with the properties of the grid container: grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows. The CSS grid is a powerful tool to create entire layouts in a simple and effective way. Thank you for reading. If you liked this article shared it! I appreciate your feedback.

author: Kara Gavin-U. Michigan
title: Primary care clinics help control ‘Essential Eight’ heart disease risks
text:
When someone has a heart attack or a stroke, specialized care can give them the best chance of surviving. But when it comes to preventing those problems in the first place, most essential care happens in general primary care clinics, a new study suggests.
Or it doesn’t happen at all, if someone can’t, won’t, or doesn’t take the time to see a primary care doctor or nurse practitioner.
The study focuses on seven of what the American Heart Association calls “Life’s Essential Eight” controllable risk factors for cardiovascular disease: high cholesterol, high blood pressure, diabetes, very high body mass index, tobacco use,
low exercise, and sleep problems such as insomnia. The data source used in the study doesn’t include information about the eighth risk factor, healthy food intake.
The study, published in
Circulation: Cardiovascular Quality and Outcomes, finds that a majority of people with any of these key measures for improving and maintaining cardiovascular health, and the majority of those taking medication to control four of those measures, saw only a primary care clinician in the past year, compared with those who saw a cardiologist alone or in addition to seeing a primary care provider.
The study also finds that large percentages of people with these major cardiovascular risk factors didn’t see either type of health care provider in the past year, even if they said they were taking medications to control their blood pressure, cholesterol, blood sugar, or stop smoking.
More than 50% of all tobacco users, 44% of those who said they have low levels of physical activity, and 38% of those with severe obesity said they hadn’t seen a
primary care provider or cardiologist in the last year. Even among those taking medication to control cardiovascular risk factors, 15% to 20% said they hadn’t seen any provider in the past year.
For the study, the researchers used data from more than 66,000 adults interviewed in-depth about their health and health care in the last year, through the nationally representative Medical Expenditure Panel Survey conducted by the federal government.
“As a society we need to recognize that preventing common conditions requires providers who can see patients often, and see the whole patient, which is the role of primary care,” says lead author Jeremy Sussman, a general internist and associate professor in the University of Michigan internal medicine department.
“While cardiovascular care guidelines are often written by specialists and subspecialists, this study shows that access to primary care is crucial to preventing or delaying some of the most common causes of death in the nation.”
The current crisis in access to primary care for American adults does not bode well for making inroads on the “Essential Eight,” Sussman notes. That crisis is caused by both a shortage of, and uneven distribution of, physicians, nurse practitioners, and physician assistants who choose to practice general internal medicine, family medicine, and geriatrics.
Long waits for appointments, and inability to
find a provider who is accepting new patients, could delay identification and management of cardiovascular risk factors, including starting new preventive medications or adjusting doses to control risk factors appropriately.
People who should make sure to see a primary care provider at least once a year—even just via a telehealth appointment—include those who have already been prescribed an antihypertensive medication to bring down high blood pressure, a diabetes drug to bring down blood sugar, a statin to control cholesterol, or a prescription
quit-smoking medication.
Regular checkups can help ensure they’re getting the most preventive power out of these medicines.
But even if they’re not taking medication, most adults with at least one cardiovascular risk factor on the “Essential Eight” list should be seeing a primary care provider regularly, Sussman says.
“Primary care providers today can manage high blood pressure, high cholesterol, most cases of diabetes, and tobacco cessation without having to refer to a specialist, though of course specialists play a key role in more complex prevention cases and post-incident care,” he says. “They can also be important entry routes to nutrition counseling, weight management and exercise programs, and sleep disorders diagnosis and treatment.”
Policy measures to enhance access to primary care by training more providers and incentivizing them to practice in shortage areas, and efforts to support primary care providers in managing cardiovascular risk factors, will be important, the authors say.
But in the immediate timeframe, they urge individuals with any of these risk factors to request an appointment with their clinic or seek one out if they don’t have a regular primary care provider.
In addition to Sussman and Sterling, who is a general internist and researcher at Weill Cornell, the study team includes author Michael Johansen, a family medicine physician with OhioHealth who trained at the University of Michigan.
Sussman is a member of the University of Michigan Institute for Healthcare Policy and Innovation, the VA Center for Clinical Management Research, and the Division of General Medicine.
The AHA committee that Sussman and Sterling serve on is a joint subcommittee of the Council on Quality of Care and Outcomes Research, and the Council on Cardiovascular and Stroke Nursing.
Additional coauthors are from Michigan Medicine, the University of Michigan’s academic medical center; OhioHealth; and Weill Cornell Medicine.
Source:
University of Michigan

author: Simon Prigent
title: Comment Theremia utilise l'IA pour optimiser l'efficacité des médicaments
text:
Créée il y a moins d'un an, la start-up parisienne lève 3 millions d'euros pour développer une plateforme capable d'adapter les traitements médicaux aux spécificités des patients. Non, les médicaments n'ont pas la même efficacité que l'on soit un homme ou une femme, selon nos caractéristiques ethniques ou le stade de la pathologie. Avec l'intelligence artificielle, il est désormais possible de les adapter aux spécificités des individus, pour des soins plus efficaces et moins d'effets secondaires.
C'est le créneau de la start-up parisienne Theremia. Lancée il y a moins d'un an par une entrepreneure, Iris Maréchal, et une chercheure, Chloé Geoffroy, cette deeptech -innovation de rupture dans le jargon - spécialisée dans la médecine de précision, annonce une levée de fonds de 3 millions d'euros pour créer sa plateforme. La technologie des deux femmes a séduit les fonds Eurazeo et Salica Investments, mais aussi Entrepreneur First, Bpifrance, et quelques business angels dont Olivier Vaury, ex-directeur financier d'Amazon France et de ManoMano, Maximilien Levesque, fondateur et PDG d'Aqemia, ou encore Claire Chappert, directeur des opérations de la biotech SafeHeal.
En combinant l'intelligence artificielle et les data sciences, l'algorithme développé par Theremia permet d'adapter des éléments tels que la fréquence d'administration, le dosage et la formulation des médicaments pour optimiser l'efficacité du traitement.
Pour illustrer l'utilité de sa solution, la PDG Iris Maréchal cite l'exemple américain de la molécule zolpidem. Cette dernière est utilisée dans les somnifères. Or, elle est associée à un risque accru d'accidents de la route, en raison de…
Simon Prigent
